frqParts.text: The graph of the function f shown above consists of two line segments. Let g be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGNbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp daWdXaWdaeaapeGaamOzaaWcpaqaa8qacaaIWaaapaqaa8qacaWG4b aaniabgUIiYdGcdaqadaWdaeaapeGaamiDaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiaa dsgacaWG0baaaa@4462@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. (a) Find g(-1), g'(-1), and g''(-1).
(b) For what values of x in the open interval (-2,2) is g increasing? Explain your reasoning.
(c) For what values of x in the open interval (-2,2) is the graph of g concave down? Explain your reasoning.
(d) On the axes provided, sketch the graph of g on the closed interval [-2,2].

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
